poem:
Title: "Condemnation in Quarters"

In Quito, uneasy mambos kissed the dawn,
An embassy, the stage, for pistols drawn -
Wild echoes woke the sleeping Aztec pride.
Of vice-presidents, dragged out, courage denied.

Obrador, fuming from his sovereign walls,
Recoils at the raid, its brutal sprawls.
In the charade of power, the chess of men,
A kingdom topples, only to rise again.
